item.title: Russian Banks work on a Blockchain Unit | HolyTransaction
item.description:
Russian Banks work on a Blockchain Unit | HolyTransaction

A few days ago Russian Banks and public institutions revealed that they will create a unit that aims at studying blockchain applications. This unit focuses on the development of "blockchain proofs-of-concept, work on joint research and policy outreach, and the creation of technology standards".

item.title: Real-time visualization tool reveals behavioral patterns in Bitcoin transactions
item.description:
Real-time visualization tool reveals behavioral patterns in Bitcoin transactions

A novel visualization method for exploring dynamic patterns in real-time Bitcoin transactional data can zoom in on individual transactions in large blocks of data and also detect meaningful associations between large numbers of transactions and recurring patterns such as money laundering.

item.title: Bitcoin Charts Show Breakout Forming Amidst Optimism
item.description:
Bitcoin Charts Show Breakout Forming Amidst Optimism

The price of Bitcoin has been somewhat stable lately with charts showing slight variances here and there over the past week. The anticipation for the upcoming halving event seems to have cryptocurrency supporters excited, while global economic events continue to show the world the benefits of the Bitcoin network.

item.title: At W3C Workshop, Industry Seeks to Weave Tangled Blockchains into the Next Web - CoinDesk
item.description:
At W3C Workshop, Industry Seeks to Weave Tangled Blockchains into the Next Web - CoinDesk

Armed with sky-high expectations and seemingly boundless enthusiasm for how tech could reinvent industry in the digital age, the "blockchain" industry has been overwhelmed with blockchains. Not only are there multiple open public blockchain projects, but legacy institutions and corporates are building exclusive permissioned blockchains.

item.title: Stealth Transactions and Reusable Payment Codes: How Bitcoin Addresses Can Be Hidden in Plain Sight
item.description:
Stealth Transactions and Reusable Payment Codes: How Bitcoin Addresses Can Be Hidden in Plain Sight

Bitcoin, right now, is not really anonymous. While Bitcoin addresses aren't necessarily linked to real-world identities, they can be. Monitoring the unencrypted peer-to-peer network, analysis of the public blockchain and know your customer (KYC) policy or anti-money laundering (AML) regulation can reveal a lot about who's using bitcoin and for what.

item.title: After Bitcoin, Chinese Go Crazy About Silver
item.description:
After Bitcoin, Chinese Go Crazy About Silver

Chinese speculators have the reputation of buying anything and everything that is going up. Real estate, the stock market, copper, bitcoin, and now silver. Futures in Shanghai reached their upside limit when prices hit $21.13 per ounce, up 6.9 percent on the day.

item.title: European Union Adopts Tighter Bitcoin Controls Amid Terrorism Crackdown - CoinDesk
item.description:
European Union Adopts Tighter Bitcoin Controls Amid Terrorism Crackdown - CoinDesk

The executive branch of the European Union today adopted a proposal meant to make it more difficult for terrorists and money-launderers to operate. Tucked halfway through the list changes proposed by the European Commission to existing anti-money laundering (AML) protections is a measure specifically designed to prevent terrorists from using virtual currencies and other financial tools deemed at risk for abuse.

item.title: How can I learn solidity if I have never programmed but I am interested in ethereum and its possibilities?
item.description:
How can I learn solidity if I have never programmed but I am interested in ethereum and its possibilities?

A great man sets an example by his actions. The whole world follows the standard that he sets...The wise should inspire others, while they themselves continue to work selflessly for the betterment of the society. - Bhagavad Gita I acknowledge and greatly respect advancement in technology, health care, standards of living and so on.

item.title: Uber Argentina Enlists Bitcoin Partner in Fight to Continue Service - CoinDesk
item.description:
Uber Argentina Enlists Bitcoin Partner in Fight to Continue Service - CoinDesk

The Argentinian subsidiary of international ridesharing giant Uber is turning to bitcoin amid what has been described as a crackdown by local authorities on its operations. Bitcoin industry startup Xapo told CoinDesk today that is has entered a partnership with Uber that allows the company to accept its bitcoin debit cards, and for users to use the payment option when traveling domestically or abroad.
